p: We identified 36 cases of acute HBV during the study period, 8 in 2015–2016 and 28 in 2017–2018 ( Figure 1; Supplementary Data). Twenty-eight (78%) patients had available HBc IgM serology (1 also had a negative HBsAg within the previous 6 months). The remaining 8 (22%) were diagnosed via a viral hepatitis syndrome without alternative explanation.
